result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Anderson

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 039467,
Payable Number: 477382,
Receipt Number: 22R 043418,
Amount: $20.00
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $2000.00

8:53 AM Defendant Michael M Anderson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to forfeit bail.
The Court will issue a bench warrant and forfeit bail.
EXT CODE 3.

8:32 AM Defendant Michael M Anderson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant states he spoke to the Public Defenders office but indicates his family is going to assist him in retaining private counsel but is still waiting to hear back from him.  
The Court informs the defendant if he is unable to retain his private counsel, he is to re-apply at the Public Defenders office.  
The Court will continue to toll the time limits for preliminary hearing and will set this matter back in one week for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Michael M Anderson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court takes short recess at 10:22 AM to allow the defendant to complete the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel. Matter recalled at 10:38 AM with the same appearances. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding his employment and income. The defendant states he is not employed. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel on Monday and the defendant is to re-apply with the Public Defender's Office today. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

2:54 PM Defendant Michael M Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia, as a friend of the court, in court for Michael M Anderson.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on September 14, 2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
